title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts, today (24), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump to meet Xi in South Korea as part of Asia swing
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping next week as part of a trip to Asia, the White House said on Thursday, confirming the meeting which had been called into question following an escalation in trade tensions.

title: Unidentified body found in sea area near Colombo Port
byline: An unidentified body has been discovered in the sea near the jetty of the Colombo Port Adani Terminal by the Colombo Port Police following information received.

title: Thai government moves to bring back 2 gifted elephants from Sri Lanka
byline: The Thai government is set to hold talks with Sri Lanka on October 28 to bring back two elephants that were gifted by Thailand, following reports of poor living conditions and alleged mistreatment.

title: Skipper of boat that took Ishara Sewwandi to India arrested in Jaffna
byline: The skipper and the boat that allegedly transported Ishara Sewwandi, a main suspect in the murder of ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’, to India have been taken into custody in Jaffna by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD), according to police.

title: One dead, 8 injured in head-on collision of van and tipper truck
byline: One person was killed while eight others, including six women from the same family, were injured and hospitalised after a van collided head-on with a tipper truck in the Vahaneri area in Valaichchenai on the Batticaloa-Polonnaruwa main road.

title: 8 including women arrested with Rs. 20 mln in cash from ‘staged robbery’
byline: Eight suspects, including a woman, have been arrested for allegedly attempting to steal over Rs. 20 million belonging to a private institution in Pettah by staging a fake robbery while an employee was transporting the money to a bank.

title: Seven remanded for operating pyramid scheme
byline: Seven suspects have been remanded after being arrested yesterday (23) on charges of operating, promoting, and managing a pyramid scheme, according to police.

title: 25 dead as bus catches fire after collision in India
byline: At least 25 passengers were reportedly killed and several others injured when a private sleeper coach travelling from Hyderabad to Bengaluru caught fire after colliding with a motorcycle near Chinnatekuru village in Kurnool district early on Friday, 24 October.

title: Trump says all trade talks with Canada are terminated
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that all trade talks with Canada were terminated following what he called a fraudulent advertisement in which former President Ronald Reagan spoke negatively about tariffs.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Dental surgeons set to launch 24-hour token strike
byline: The Government Dental Surgeons’ Association (GDSA) has declared an island-wide token strike on 06 November 2025, to protest against the “ongoing administrative collapse” within the Dental Services Division of the Ministry of Health.

title: King Charles hosts Ukraine’s Zelensky at Windsor Castle
byline: King Charles III hosted President Volodymyr Zelensky in Windsor Friday, ahead of the Ukrainian leader’s latest talks with European leaders in London on how to increase pressure on Russia.

title: Six Sri Lankan seafarers detained in Eritrea repatriated
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, in close coordination with the Sri Lanka Mission in Egypt and the Eritrean authorities, has successfully facilitated the repatriation of six Sri Lankan seafarers who were previously detained in Eritrea.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds, heavy showers and rough seas
byline: An ‘Amber’ weather advisory has been issued for strong winds, heavy showers and rough seas for multi-day boats in the Bay of Bengal sea area by the Department of Meteorology.

title: Weligama PS chairman’s murder: Shooter a security forces deserter?
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that new information is emerging regarding the shooter involved in the recent killing of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara.

title: SriLankan Airlines issues clarification on 2024/25 financial performance
byline: SriLankan Airlines today issued a clarification regarding the recent reports concerning the airline’s financial performance for the financial year 2024/25.

title: Committee on Public Finance approves 2026 Appropriation Bill
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (COPF) has granted its approval for the Appropriation Bill for the year 2026, according to the Department of Parliament Communication.

title: Unit of Ram Charan, Janhvi Kapoor’s ‘Peddi’ heads to Sri Lanka for next schedule
byline: The unit of director Buchi Babu Sana’s eagerly awaited action extravaganza ‘Peddi’, featuring Telugu star Ram Charan in the lead, has now headed to Sri Lanka for the next schedule of the film.

title: SLC to allocate Rs. 1.5 bln annually for school cricket development
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) will allocate nearly Rs. 1.5 billion annually for the development and promotion of school cricket, according to Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports Sunil Kumara Gamage.

title: SJB MP Jagath Withana alleges death threats, calls for security
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Member of Parliament Jagath Withana has alleged receiving death threats, claiming that he has received information that there is an attempt to shoot him.

title: US President Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao
byline: US President Donald Trump has pardoned Binance founder Changpeng Zhao, who created the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange and served prison time for failing to stop criminals from using the platform to move money connected to child sex abuse, drug trafficking and terrorism.

title: Sri Lankan writer Vajra Chandrasekera wins 2025 Ursula K Le Guin Prize for Fiction
byline: Sri Lankan author Vajra Chandrasekera’s second novel, Rakesfall, has won the 2025 Ursula K Le Guin Prize for Fiction, a $25,000 award recognising “writers who imagine real grounds for hope.”

title: Sri Lankan Army refurbishes 76 unserviceable vehicles, saving Rs. 10 mln per month
byline: A total of 76 vehicles of the Sri Lanka Army that had been in long-term use and had become unserviceable have been fully restored to motorable condition  and are scheduled to be added to the Army vehicle fleet from today (24).

title: Four suspects further remanded for aiding escape of Ishara Sewwandi
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the further remand of two male suspects and two female suspects who were arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting the escape of Ishara Sewwandi, a main suspect in the murder of ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’, until November 7.

title: Govt’s development agenda rooted in sustainability and human dignity – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the Government’s development agenda is rooted in sustainability and human dignity and that the Government aims to uplift every community and ensure that progress reaches all corners of the country.

title: IMF urges Asia to cut trade barriers to beat US tariffs
byline: The International Monetary Fund on Friday urged Asia to lower non-tariff barriers and integrate regional trade to reduce its vulnerability to U.S. tariffs and global financial shocks.

title: Appeals Court orders Customs to expedite probe into BYD motor capacity
byline: The Court of Appeal today ordered Sri Lanka Customs to promptly conclude the investigation into the motor capacities of BYD vehicles currently detained by customs.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several districts extended
byline: Early landslide warning issued for several districts of the island owing to the prevailing heavy rain, have been extended. More..

title: Two arrested for soliciting bribe to offer job at Ports Authority
byline: A former official of the Fisheries Department and a staff member of former Deputy Minister of Housing and Construction Indika Bandaranayake have been arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Chamod and Pasindu win gold, Viknaraj clinches silver at South Asian Athletics Championship
byline: Sri Lanka has won two gold medals and a silver at the 4th SAAF South Asian Senior Athletics Championship, which kicked off on Friday (24) at the Birsa Munda Football Stadium in Ranchi, India.

title: Sri Lanka sees 8 pct drop in marriages in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka recorded a notable decline in marriages in 2024, according to the latest data from the Department of Census and Statistics.
